provis.utils.charges_utils module

Utility functions for computing hydrogen bonds and electrostatics on protein surface.

provis.utils.charges_utils.compute_angle_deviation(a: numpy.ndarray, b: numpy.ndarray, c: numpy.ndarray, theta: float) → float

Computes the absolute angle deviation from theta. a, b, c form the three points that define the angle.

Parameters

  • name – a - Coordinate vector of the first point.

  • type – np.ndarray,

  • name – b - Coordinate vector of the second point.

  • type – np.ndarray,

  • name – c - Coordinate vector of the third point.

  • type – np.ndarray,

  • name – theta - Angle to compute deviation with respect to.

  • type – float

Returns

float - absolute deviation of the angle formed by a, b, c with theta

provis.utils.charges_utils.compute_angle_penalty(angle_deviation: float) → float

Compute the angle penalty corresponding to angle of deviation.

Parameters

  • name – angle_deviation - Angle of deviation.

  • type – float

Returns

float - Angle penalty.

provis.utils.charges_utils.compute_hbond_helper(atom_name: str, res: Bio.PDB.Residue.Residue, v: numpy.ndarray) → float

Helper function. Computes the charge of the vertex

Parameters

  • name – atom_name - Name of atom.

  • type – str

  • name – res - Residue corresponding to atom.

  • type – Residue

  • name – v - Vertices.

  • type – np.ndarray

Returns

float - charge of the vertex

provis.utils.charges_utils.compute_plane_deviation(a: numpy.ndarray, b: numpy.ndarray, c: numpy.ndarray, d: numpy.ndarray) → float

Computes the absolute plane deviation from theta. a, b, c form the three points that define the angle.

Parameters

  • name – a - Coordinate vector of the first point.

  • type – np.ndarray,

  • name – b - Coordinate vector of the second point.

  • type – np.ndarray,

  • name – c - Coordinate vector of the third point.

  • type – np.ndarray,

  • name – theta - Angle to compute deviation with respect to.

  • type – float

Returns

float - absolute deviation of the angle formed by a, b, c with theta

provis.utils.charges_utils.compute_satisfied_CO_HN(atoms)

Compute the list of backbone C=O:H-N that are satisfied. These will be ignored.

Parameters

  • name – atoms - list of atoms to be checked.

  • type – BioPython atoms

Returns

set - set of C=O bonds

Returns

set - set of H-N bonds

Check if atom is acceptor atom.

Parameters

  • type – str

  • name – res - The corresponding residue

  • type – Residue

Returns

bool - True if conditions met

  • name – res_name - Residue name

  • type – str

provis.utils.charges_utils.normalize_electrostatics(in_elec: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray

Normalizing charges on the surface, by clipping to upper and lower thresholds and converting all values to a -1/1 scale.

Parameters

  • name – in_elec - Input charges for all surface vertices

  • type – np.ndarray

Returns

np.ndarray - Normalized surface vertex charges

provis.utils.name_checker module

class provis.utils.name_checker.NameChecker(name, base_path: Optional[str] = None)

Bases: object

The point of this class is to provide uniform naming and path locations to all the other classes of provis. NameChecker has class variables and a class method to return these variables.

Variables: pdb_name - Full path to the pdb file without the .pdb extension. Usually PROVIS_PATH/data/pdb/{pdb_id}. out_path - Full path to the temporary files. The names of all temporary files are derived from this variable. Usually PROVIS_PATH/data/tmp/{pdb_id}. base_path - Full path of the provis directory or any directory that has the following directory structure within: {path}/data/data, {path}/data/img, {path}/data/tmp, {path}/data/pdb.

base_path = ''
out_path = ''
pdb_name = ''
classmethod return_all()

Return all class variables.

Returns

str - path to the input pdb id (file without the extension)

Returns

str - path to the output pdb id - data/tmp/{pdb_id}

Returns

str - path to the root of the provis directory. Following file structure HAS TO exist within: {path}/data/data, {path}/data/img, {path}/data/tmp, {path}/data/pdb.

provis.utils.surface_feat module

https://github.com/bunnech/holoprot/blob/main/holoprot/feat/surface.py is the base for this file. Modifications were made.

Functions to compute features for a patch on the protein surface.

Some of these are borrowed from https://github.com/LPDI-EPFL/masif under the https://github.com/LPDI-EPFL/masif/blob/master/LICENSE license

provis.utils.surface_feat.assign_props_to_new_mesh(new_vertices, old_vertices: numpy.ndarray, old_props: numpy.ndarray, feature_interpolation: bool = True) → numpy.ndarray

Assign properties to vertices in modified mesh given the initial mesh. The assignment is carried using a KDTree data structure to query nearest points.

Parameters

  • name – new_vertices - Vertices on the modified mesh

  • type – np.ndarray

  • name – old_vertices - Vertices on the original mesh

  • type – np.ndarray

  • name – old_props - Property values for each vertex on the original mesh

  • type – np.ndarray

  • name – feature_interpolation - If set to True interpolates features to new vertices.

  • type – bool, (default True)

Returns

np.ndarray - Property values for vertices on the modified mesh

provis.utils.surface_feat.compute_charges(vertices: numpy.ndarray, pdb_id: str, path: str) → numpy.ndarray

Computes electrostatics for the surface vertices. The function first calls the PDB2PQR executable to prepare the pdb file for electrostatics. Poisson- Boltzmann electrostatics are computed using APSB executable. Multivalue, provided within APSB suite is used to assign charges to each vertex. The charges are further normalized.

Parameters

  • name – vertices - Surface vertex coordinates

  • type – np.ndarray

  • name – pdb_id - PDB ID of the protein

  • type – str

  • name – path - Path of the pqr file in the form {path}.pqr

  • type – str

Returns

np.ndarray - Charge values for each vertex

provis.utils.surface_feat.compute_hbonds(vertices: numpy.ndarray, residues: List[Bio.PDB.Residue.Residue], names: List[str]) → numpy.ndarray

Compute H-bond (hydrogen-bond) induced charges at every vertex.

Parameters

  • name – vertices - Vertices of mesh

  • type – np.ndarray

  • name – residues - List of residues to compute

  • type – List[Residue]

  • name – names - List of custom names created by output_pdb_as_xyzrn()

  • type – List[str]

Returns

np.ndarray - Array of bonds, by vertex

provis.utils.surface_feat.compute_hydrophobicity(names: List[str]) → numpy.ndarray

Compute hydrophobicity value for all vertices on the surface. Each surface vertex has a mapping to the corresponding residue from the original protein. This is used to assign a hydrophobicity value to each vertex using the Kyte- Doolittle scale.

Parameters

  • name – names - Identifier names for each vertex in the surface

  • type – List[str]

Returns

np.ndarray - Hydrophobicity values for each surface vertex

provis.utils.surface_feat.compute_shape_index(mesh) → numpy.ndarray

Computes shape index for the patches. Shape index characterizes the shape around a point on the surface, computed using the local curvature around each point. These values are derived using Trimesh’s available geometric processing functionality.

Parameters

  • name – mesh: The mesh is constructed using information about vertices and faces.

  • type – Trimesh

Returns

np.ndarray - Shape index for each vertex

provis.utils.surface_feat.compute_surface_features(surface: Tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray, List[str], Dict[str, str]], pdb_file: str, path: str, mesh=None, fix_mesh: bool = False, return_mesh: bool = False, pdb_id: Optional[str] = None) → Tuple[numpy.ndarray]

Computes all patch features.

Parameters

  • name – surface: Tuple of attributes characterizing the surface. These include vertices, faces, normals to each vertex, areas, fdue identifiers for vertices.

  • type – Surface

  • name – pdb_file - PDB File containing the atomic coordinates

  • type – str

  • name – path - Path to files without extensions. Usually data/tmp/{pdb_id}

  • type – str

  • name – mesh - The mesh.

  • type – trimesh.Trimesh

  • name – fix_mesh - Whether to fix the mesh by collapsing nodes and edges. Default: False.

  • type – bool, optional

  • name – return_mesh - Whether to return the mesh. Default: False.

  • type – bool, optional

  • name – pdb_id - PDB id of the associated protein. Default: None

  • type – str, optional

Returns

np.ndarray - Shape index

Returns

np.ndarray - Hydrogen bond induced charges

Returns

np.ndarray - Hydrophobicity of each surface vertex

Returns

np.ndarray - Electrostatics of each surface vertex

provis.utils.surface_utils module

https://github.com/bunnech/holoprot/blob/main/holoprot/utils/surface.py is the base for this file. Modifications were made.

Utilities for preparing and computing features on molecular surfaces.

provis.utils.surface_utils.compute_normal(vertices: numpy.ndarray, faces: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray

Compute normals for the vertices and faces

Parameters

  • name – vertices - Vertices of the mesh

  • type – np.ndarray

  • name – faces - Faces of the mesh

  • type – np.ndarray

Returns

np.ndarray - Normals of the mesh

provis.utils.surface_utils.crossp(x: numpy.ndarray, y: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray

Creates the cross product of two numpy arrays

Parameters

  • name – x - Array 1

  • type – np.ndarray

  • name – y - Array 2

  • type – np.ndarray

Returns

np.ndarray - (Array 1) x (Array 2)

provis.utils.surface_utils.fix_trimesh(mesh, resolution: float = 1.0)

Applies a predefined set of fixes to the mesh, and converts it to a specified resolution. These fixes include removing duplicated vertices wihin a certain threshold, removing degenerate triangles, splitting longer edges to a given target length, and collapsing shorter edges.

Parameters

  • name – mesh - Mesh

  • type – trimesh.Trimesh

  • name – resolution - Maximum size of edge in the mesh

  • tyoe – float

Returns

trimesh.Trimesh - mesh with all fixes applied

provis.utils.surface_utils.get_surface(out_path: str, density: float = 0.5, remove_files: bool = True)

Wrapper function that reads in the output from the MSMS executable to build the protein surface.

Parameters

  • name – out_path - path to output (output path from namechecker) directory. Usually data/tmp

  • type – str

  • name – remove_files - Whether to remove the intermediate output files. Default: True.

  • type – bool

Returns

numpy.ndarray - vertices

Returns

numpy.ndarray - faces

Returns

numpy.ndarray - vertex normals

Returns

list - List of res_id’s from output_pdb_as_xyzrn()

Returns

dict - Dictionary: residues as keys, areas as values

provis.utils.surface_utils.output_pdb_as_xyzrn(pdb_file: str, xyzrn_file: str) → None

Converts a .pdb file to a .xyzrn file.

Parameters

  • name – pdb_file - path to PDB File to convert (with extension)

  • type – str

  • name – xyzrn_file - path to the xyzrn File (with extension)

  • type – str

provis.utils.surface_utils.prepare_trimesh(vertices: numpy.ndarray, faces: numpy.ndarray, normals: Optional[numpy.ndarray] = None, resolution: float = 1.0, apply_fixes: bool = False)

Prepare the mesh surface given vertices and faces. Optionally, compute normals and apply fixes to mesh.

Parameters

  • name – vertices - Surface vertices

  • type – np.ndarray

  • name – faces - Triangular faces on the mesh

  • type – np.ndarray

  • name – normals - Normals for each vertex

  • type – np.ndarray

  • name – apply_fixes - Optional application of fixes to mesh. Check fix_mesh for details on fixes. Default: False,

  • type – bool

Returns

trimesh.Trimesh - Mesh

provis.utils.surface_utils.read_msms(file_root: str) → Tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray, List[str]]

Read surface constituents from output files generated using MSMS.

Parameters

  • type – str

Returns

numpy.ndarray - vertices

Returns

numpy.ndarray - faces

Returns

numpy.ndarray - vertex normals

Returns

list - List of res_id’s from output_pdb_as_xyzrn()
